events.originalText: Led by Jigme Thinley, the Bhutan Peace and Prosperity Party won 45 of 47 seats in the country's first National Assembly election.
events.subtitle: Jigme Thinley
events.headline: Bhutan Peace and Prosperity Party Wins 45 of 47 Seats in National Assembly Election

events.originalText: One day after making a plea to Salvadoran soldiers to stop carrying out the government's repression, Archbishop Óscar Romero was assassinated while celebrating Mass in San Salvador.
events.subtitle: Revolutionary Government Junta of El Salvador
events.headline: Archbishop Óscar Romero Assassinated in San Salvador

events.originalText: The British Cabinet Mission arrived in New Delhi to discuss the transfer of power from the colonial government to Indian leadership.
events.subtitle: 1946 Cabinet Mission to India
events.headline: British Cabinet Mission Arrives in New Delhi for Transfer of Power Discussions

events.originalText: The Tydings–McDuffie Act came into effect, which provided for self-government of the Philippines and for Filipino independence from the United States after a period of ten years.
events.subtitle: Tydings–McDuffie Act
events.headline: Tydings–McDuffie Act Provides Path to Filipino Independence from US

events.originalText: Irish War of Independence: In Belfast, two men wearing police uniforms broke into a house and murdered a Catholic family in what was believed to be a reprisal for the deaths of two policemen the day before.
events.subtitle: Irish War of Independence
events.headline: Catholic Family Murdered in Belfast Reprisal Attack

events.originalText: The inaugural Women's Olympiad, the first international women's sports event, opened at the International Sporting Club of Monaco in Monte Carlo.
events.subtitle: 1921 Women's Olympiad
events.headline: Inaugural Women's Olympiad Opens in Monte Carlo

events.originalText: The Winton Motor Carriage Company (ad pictured), one of the first American car companies, sold its first unit.
events.subtitle: Winton Motor Carriage Company
events.headline: Winton Motor Carriage Company Sells First Unit

events.originalText: German physician Robert Koch announced the discovery of Mycobacterium tuberculosis, the pathogen that causes tuberculosis.
events.subtitle: Robert Koch
events.headline: Robert Koch Discovers Mycobacterium Tuberculosis Pathogen

events.originalText: New Zealand Wars: Māori leader Tītokowaru's conflict ended with the last of his forces surrendering to the New Zealand colonial government.
events.subtitle: New Zealand Wars
events.headline: Māori Leader Tītokowaru's Conflict Ends with Surrender to Colonial Government

events.originalText: Japanese chief minister Ii Naosuke was assassinated by rōnin samurai upset with his role in opening Japan to foreign powers.
events.subtitle: Ii Naosuke
events.headline: Japanese Chief Minister Ii Naosuke Assassinated by Samurai

events.originalText: James VI of Scotland (pictured) succeeded to the thrones of England and Ireland as James I, uniting the realms under a single monarch.
events.subtitle: James VI and I
events.headline: James VI of Scotland Succeeds to Thrones of England and Ireland as James I
